Sears Home AdvantageAppointment Lookup802-552-4364Schedule NowRepairHome WarrantyTune-Up & MaintainHVACShop PartsResourcesSears LogoRepairFrigidaire+Range{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair","name":"Repair"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/frigidaire","name":"Frigidaire"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":3,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/range-repair-service","name":"Range"}]}Frigidaire Range RepairWe're in your neighborhood, and we'll fix it no matter where you bought it.Schedule service your waySchedule NowCall(802) 552-4364ChatWill you be using repair benefits from a Sears or other warranty plan?Frigidaire Range Repair: Expert Solutions for Common Problems Is your Frigidaire range not heating correctly? Are the burners failing to ignite? Or perhaps the control panel is unresponsive? These common issues can disrupt your cooking routine, but understanding their causes can help you determine whether simple maintenance, DIY repairs, or professional service is your best next step. Our comprehensive guide combines technical expertise with practical solutions to address the most frequent Frigidaire range problems.
Understanding Your Frigidaire Range Components
Every Frigidaire range, whether gas or electric, combines several key systems that work together to deliver reliable cooking performance. Electric models use precision heating elements for both cooktop and oven functions, while gas models employ a network of valves, igniters, and burners to create and control cooking heat. The control system—which may be simple knobs or a sophisticated digital interface—acts as the command center for all functions.
With regular maintenance and timely repairs when issues arise, your Frigidaire range can provide many years of dependable service for all your cooking needs.
Troubleshooting Electric Frigidaire Range Problems
Surface Burner Issues
When electric cooktop elements fail to heat properly, the problem usually stems from one of these common causes:


Damaged Heating Element: After years of use, elements can develop weak spots, breaks, or visible damage that affects their performance


Faulty Burner Receptacle: The socket that connects the element to the range's electrical system can deteriorate from heat cycling


Connection Problems: Loose or corroded connections between components can cause intermittent heating


Control Switch Failure: The switch that regulates power to the element may be malfunctioning


How to Check: Carefully swap a problematic burner with one you know works well. If the problem moves with the element, you need a replacement element. If the problem stays in the same location, the receptacle or wiring likely needs attention.
Oven Not Heating Correctly
When your Frigidaire electric oven fails to heat properly, check for these common culprits:


Failed Bake Element: Look for visible damage like blisters, breaks, or discoloration on the element at the oven bottom


Defective Broil Element: The upper element may have failed, affecting overall heating and broiling function


Temperature Sensor Problems: A faulty sensor can cause inaccurate temperature regulation


Control Board Issues: The electronic "brain" of the oven may be malfunctioning, causing heating inconsistencies


Visual Inspection Tip: With the oven cool and power disconnected, examine the bake element for visible breaks or blistering. Damage usually indicates the element needs replacement.
When you’re unable to find and resolve a range problem on your own, schedule stove repair and we’ll send a Sears Home Services technician to your home to fix the problem for you.
Diagnosing Gas Frigidaire Range Problems
Cooktop Burner Difficulties
Gas burners that won't light or heat inconsistently typically point to these issues:


Igniter Failure: The spark igniter may be cracked, misaligned, or electrically faulty


Clogged Burner Ports: Food spillover can block gas flow through the burner openings


Gas Supply Problems: Verify the gas valve is fully open and supplying all burners


Control Valve Issues: The valve regulating gas flow to the burner may be malfunctioning


Safety First: If you smell gas, immediately turn off the gas supply valve, avoid creating sparks or flames, ventilate the area, and call for professional service.
Oven Heating Failures
Gas oven problems usually involve these components:


Weak or Failed Igniter: The "glow bar" igniter must get hot enough to open the safety valve; as igniters age, they may glow but not reach sufficient temperature


Gas Safety Valve Problems: The valve controlling gas flow to the oven burner may be stuck or failing


Faulty Temperature Regulation: Issues with the thermostat or temperature sensor can cause inconsistent heating


Control Module Failures: Electronic controls can malfunction, affecting all oven functions


Key Symptom: If your igniter glows for more than 90 seconds without lighting the burner, it's likely too weak to open the safety valve and needs replacement.
When you’re unable to resolve an oven heating problem on your own, schedule Frigidaire range repair service and we’ll send a technician to your home to fix the oven.
Electronic Control and Display Problems
Modern Frigidaire ranges often feature sophisticated control systems that can experience unique issues:


Unresponsive Touchpads: Control panels may stop responding to touch or button presses


Error Code Displays: Digital screens may show specific error codes indicating particular failures


Erratic Operation: Ranges may turn on/off unexpectedly or change settings without input


Power Issues: Control boards can be affected by power surges or internal component failures


Quick Fix Attempt: For many electronic issues, resetting the range can help. Disconnect power for 1-2 minutes by unplugging the range or turning off the circuit breaker, then restore power.
For smart-enabled Frigidaire ranges, connectivity problems may involve:


WiFi module malfunction


Home network configuration issues


Software or firmware that needs updating


Account or app synchronization problems


Real-World Repair Success Stories
Case Study: Control Board Replacement Saves Expensive Range
A family with a Frigidaire Gallery Series electric range experienced frequent shutoffs, error codes, and an unresponsive touchpad. Assuming these symptoms meant the end for their appliance, they were preparing to purchase a replacement. However, professional diagnosis identified a failing electronic control board as the sole issue.
A certified technician replaced just this component—a repair costing significantly less than a new range. The appliance returned to perfect working condition, saving the family considerable expense and the inconvenience of selecting and installing a new range.
Case Study: The Importance of Proper Diagnosis
After replacing the igniter in their gas oven based on internet advice, a homeowner was frustrated when heating problems persisted. Professional diagnosis revealed that while the new igniter was working correctly, the gas safety valve wasn't opening fully due to an electrical issue in the control system.
This case highlights the value of accurate professional diagnosis—identifying the actual cause rather than just addressing symptoms based on common problems.
Preventative Maintenance for Your Frigidaire Range
Regular appliance maintenance significantly extends your range's lifespan and prevents many common issues.
For Electric Ranges:


Keep surface elements clean from food buildup


Check for loose connections at element receptacles


Clean the oven interior regularly to prevent residue from burning onto elements


Verify that drip pans are clean and properly positioned


For Gas Ranges:


Clean burner caps and ports regularly to ensure proper gas flow


Inspect igniter electrodes for food debris or misalignment


Check for loose gas connections (if you smell gas, call for service immediately)


Ensure burner grates sit properly on the cooktop


General Maintenance:


Wipe up spills promptly to prevent baked-on residue


Clean control knobs and panels with appropriate non-abrasive cleaners


Check door gaskets for tears or gaps that might affect oven efficiency


Follow manufacturer guidelines for self-cleaning functions to avoid component stress


When Professional Frigidaire Range Repair Is Necessary
While some maintenance is DIY-friendly, certain situations require professional range repair expertise:


Gas-Related Issues: Any problem involving gas connections or persistent gas odors


Electrical Repairs: Internal wiring problems or electronic control failures


Calibration Needs: Precise temperature adjustment requires specialized tools


Persistent Problems: Issues that continue after basic troubleshooting


Component Replacement: Many internal parts require technical knowledge for proper installation


Safety Priority: Always disconnect power before attempting electric range inspections. For gas ranges, never attempt to repair gas-specific components unless you have professional training.
Why Choose Sears Home Services for Your Frigidaire Range Repair
When your Frigidaire range needs professional attention, Sears Home Services offers significant advantages:


Manufacturer-Specific Training: Our technicians receive specialized training on Frigidaire appliances


Genuine Replacement Parts: We use only authentic Frigidaire components designed for your specific model


Diagnostic Expertise: Our systematic troubleshooting identifies root causes, not just symptoms


Nationwide Service Network: Consistent quality standards wherever you're located


Service Guarantee: We stand behind our repairs with solid warranty coverage


Our technicians have successfully completed over 100,000 Frigidaire range repairs, building unmatched expertise with these appliances.
Schedule Your Frigidaire Range Repair Today
Don't let cooking problems persist. Our experienced technicians can quickly diagnose and repair your Frigidaire range, restoring perfect functionality.
Schedule range repair service online now or call 1-800-374-4432 to speak with our customer service team.

RepairFrigidaire+Range{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair","name":"Repair"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/frigidaire","name":"Frigidaire"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":3,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/range-repair-service","name":"Range"}]}Frigidaire Range RepairWe're in your neighborhood, and we'll fix it no matter where you bought it.Schedule service your waySchedule NowCall(802) 552-4364ChatWill you be using repair benefits from a Sears or other warranty plan?Frigidaire Range Repair: Expert Solutions for Common Problems Is your Frigidaire range not heating correctly? Are the burners failing to ignite? Or perhaps the control panel is unresponsive? These common issues can disrupt your cooking routine, but understanding their causes can help you determine whether simple maintenance, DIY repairs, or professional service is your best next step. Our comprehensive guide combines technical expertise with practical solutions to address the most frequent Frigidaire range problems.
Understanding Your Frigidaire Range Components
Every Frigidaire range, whether gas or electric, combines several key systems that work together to deliver reliable cooking performance. Electric models use precision heating elements for both cooktop and oven functions, while gas models employ a network of valves, igniters, and burners to create and control cooking heat. The control system—which may be simple knobs or a sophisticated digital interface—acts as the command center for all functions.
With regular maintenance and timely repairs when issues arise, your Frigidaire range can provide many years of dependable service for all your cooking needs.
Troubleshooting Electric Frigidaire Range Problems
Surface Burner Issues
When electric cooktop elements fail to heat properly, the problem usually stems from one of these common causes:


Damaged Heating Element: After years of use, elements can develop weak spots, breaks, or visible damage that affects their performance


Faulty Burner Receptacle: The socket that connects the element to the range's electrical system can deteriorate from heat cycling


Connection Problems: Loose or corroded connections between components can cause intermittent heating


Control Switch Failure: The switch that regulates power to the element may be malfunctioning


How to Check: Carefully swap a problematic burner with one you know works well. If the problem moves with the element, you need a replacement element. If the problem stays in the same location, the receptacle or wiring likely needs attention.
Oven Not Heating Correctly
When your Frigidaire electric oven fails to heat properly, check for these common culprits:


Failed Bake Element: Look for visible damage like blisters, breaks, or discoloration on the element at the oven bottom


Defective Broil Element: The upper element may have failed, affecting overall heating and broiling function


Temperature Sensor Problems: A faulty sensor can cause inaccurate temperature regulation


Control Board Issues: The electronic "brain" of the oven may be malfunctioning, causing heating inconsistencies


Visual Inspection Tip: With the oven cool and power disconnected, examine the bake element for visible breaks or blistering. Damage usually indicates the element needs replacement.
When you’re unable to find and resolve a range problem on your own, schedule stove repair and we’ll send a Sears Home Services technician to your home to fix the problem for you.
Diagnosing Gas Frigidaire Range Problems
Cooktop Burner Difficulties
Gas burners that won't light or heat inconsistently typically point to these issues:


Igniter Failure: The spark igniter may be cracked, misaligned, or electrically faulty


Clogged Burner Ports: Food spillover can block gas flow through the burner openings


Gas Supply Problems: Verify the gas valve is fully open and supplying all burners


Control Valve Issues: The valve regulating gas flow to the burner may be malfunctioning


Safety First: If you smell gas, immediately turn off the gas supply valve, avoid creating sparks or flames, ventilate the area, and call for professional service.
Oven Heating Failures
Gas oven problems usually involve these components:


Weak or Failed Igniter: The "glow bar" igniter must get hot enough to open the safety valve; as igniters age, they may glow but not reach sufficient temperature


Gas Safety Valve Problems: The valve controlling gas flow to the oven burner may be stuck or failing


Faulty Temperature Regulation: Issues with the thermostat or temperature sensor can cause inconsistent heating


Control Module Failures: Electronic controls can malfunction, affecting all oven functions


Key Symptom: If your igniter glows for more than 90 seconds without lighting the burner, it's likely too weak to open the safety valve and needs replacement.
When you’re unable to resolve an oven heating problem on your own, schedule Frigidaire range repair service and we’ll send a technician to your home to fix the oven.
Electronic Control and Display Problems
Modern Frigidaire ranges often feature sophisticated control systems that can experience unique issues:


Unresponsive Touchpads: Control panels may stop responding to touch or button presses


Error Code Displays: Digital screens may show specific error codes indicating particular failures


Erratic Operation: Ranges may turn on/off unexpectedly or change settings without input


Power Issues: Control boards can be affected by power surges or internal component failures


Quick Fix Attempt: For many electronic issues, resetting the range can help. Disconnect power for 1-2 minutes by unplugging the range or turning off the circuit breaker, then restore power.
For smart-enabled Frigidaire ranges, connectivity problems may involve:


WiFi module malfunction


Home network configuration issues


Software or firmware that needs updating


Account or app synchronization problems


Real-World Repair Success Stories
Case Study: Control Board Replacement Saves Expensive Range
A family with a Frigidaire Gallery Series electric range experienced frequent shutoffs, error codes, and an unresponsive touchpad. Assuming these symptoms meant the end for their appliance, they were preparing to purchase a replacement. However, professional diagnosis identified a failing electronic control board as the sole issue.
A certified technician replaced just this component—a repair costing significantly less than a new range. The appliance returned to perfect working condition, saving the family considerable expense and the inconvenience of selecting and installing a new range.
Case Study: The Importance of Proper Diagnosis
After replacing the igniter in their gas oven based on internet advice, a homeowner was frustrated when heating problems persisted. Professional diagnosis revealed that while the new igniter was working correctly, the gas safety valve wasn't opening fully due to an electrical issue in the control system.
This case highlights the value of accurate professional diagnosis—identifying the actual cause rather than just addressing symptoms based on common problems.
Preventative Maintenance for Your Frigidaire Range
Regular appliance maintenance significantly extends your range's lifespan and prevents many common issues.
For Electric Ranges:


Keep surface elements clean from food buildup


Check for loose connections at element receptacles


Clean the oven interior regularly to prevent residue from burning onto elements


Verify that drip pans are clean and properly positioned


For Gas Ranges:


Clean burner caps and ports regularly to ensure proper gas flow


Inspect igniter electrodes for food debris or misalignment


Check for loose gas connections (if you smell gas, call for service immediately)


Ensure burner grates sit properly on the cooktop


General Maintenance:


Wipe up spills promptly to prevent baked-on residue


Clean control knobs and panels with appropriate non-abrasive cleaners


Check door gaskets for tears or gaps that might affect oven efficiency


Follow manufacturer guidelines for self-cleaning functions to avoid component stress


When Professional Frigidaire Range Repair Is Necessary
While some maintenance is DIY-friendly, certain situations require professional range repair expertise:


Gas-Related Issues: Any problem involving gas connections or persistent gas odors


Electrical Repairs: Internal wiring problems or electronic control failures


Calibration Needs: Precise temperature adjustment requires specialized tools


Persistent Problems: Issues that continue after basic troubleshooting


Component Replacement: Many internal parts require technical knowledge for proper installation


Safety Priority: Always disconnect power before attempting electric range inspections. For gas ranges, never attempt to repair gas-specific components unless you have professional training.
Why Choose Sears Home Services for Your Frigidaire Range Repair
When your Frigidaire range needs professional attention, Sears Home Services offers significant advantages:


Manufacturer-Specific Training: Our technicians receive specialized training on Frigidaire appliances


Genuine Replacement Parts: We use only authentic Frigidaire components designed for your specific model


Diagnostic Expertise: Our systematic troubleshooting identifies root causes, not just symptoms


Nationwide Service Network: Consistent quality standards wherever you're located


Service Guarantee: We stand behind our repairs with solid warranty coverage


Our technicians have successfully completed over 100,000 Frigidaire range repairs, building unmatched expertise with these appliances.
Schedule Your Frigidaire Range Repair Today
Don't let cooking problems persist. Our experienced technicians can quickly diagnose and repair your Frigidaire range, restoring perfect functionality.
Schedule range repair service online now or call 1-800-374-4432 to speak with our customer service team.

Gas Supply Problems: Verify the gas valve is fully open and supplying all burners


Control Valve Issues: The valve regulating gas flow to the burner may be malfunctioning


Safety First: If you smell gas, immediately turn off the gas supply valve, avoid creating sparks or flames, ventilate the area, and call for professional service.
Oven Heating Failures
Gas oven problems usually involve these components:


Weak or Failed Igniter: The "glow bar" igniter must get hot enough to open the safety valve; as igniters age, they may glow but not reach sufficient temperature


Gas Safety Valve Problems: The valve controlling gas flow to the oven burner may be stuck or failing


Faulty Temperature Regulation: Issues with the thermostat or temperature sensor can cause inconsistent heating


Control Module Failures: Electronic controls can malfunction, affecting all oven functions


Key Symptom: If your igniter glows for more than 90 seconds without lighting the burner, it's likely too weak to open the safety valve and needs replacement.
When you’re unable to resolve an oven heating problem on your own, schedule Frigidaire range repair service and we’ll send a technician to your home to fix the oven.
Electronic Control and Display Problems
Modern Frigidaire ranges often feature sophisticated control systems that can experience unique issues:


Unresponsive Touchpads: Control panels may stop responding to touch or button presses


Error Code Displays: Digital screens may show specific error codes indicating particular failures


Erratic Operation: Ranges may turn on/off unexpectedly or change settings without input


Power Issues: Control boards can be affected by power surges or internal component failures


Quick Fix Attempt: For many electronic issues, resetting the range can help. Disconnect power for 1-2 minutes by unplugging the range or turning off the circuit breaker, then restore power.
For smart-enabled Frigidaire ranges, connectivity problems may involve:


WiFi module malfunction


Home network configuration issues


Software or firmware that needs updating


Account or app synchronization problems


Real-World Repair Success Stories
Case Study: Control Board Replacement Saves Expensive Range
A family with a Frigidaire Gallery Series electric range experienced frequent shutoffs, error codes, and an unresponsive touchpad. Assuming these symptoms meant the end for their appliance, they were preparing to purchase a replacement. However, professional diagnosis identified a failing electronic control board as the sole issue.
A certified technician replaced just this component—a repair costing significantly less than a new range. The appliance returned to perfect working condition, saving the family considerable expense and the inconvenience of selecting and installing a new range.
Case Study: The Importance of Proper Diagnosis
After replacing the igniter in their gas oven based on internet advice, a homeowner was frustrated when heating problems persisted. Professional diagnosis revealed that while the new igniter was working correctly, the gas safety valve wasn't opening fully due to an electrical issue in the control system.
This case highlights the value of accurate professional diagnosis—identifying the actual cause rather than just addressing symptoms based on common problems.
Preventative Maintenance for Your Frigidaire Range
Regular appliance maintenance significantly extends your range's lifespan and prevents many common issues.
For Electric Ranges:


Keep surface elements clean from food buildup


Check for loose connections at element receptacles


Clean the oven interior regularly to prevent residue from burning onto elements


Verify that drip pans are clean and properly positioned


For Gas Ranges:


Clean burner caps and ports regularly to ensure proper gas flow


Inspect igniter electrodes for food debris or misalignment


Check for loose gas connections (if you smell gas, call for service immediately)


Ensure burner grates sit properly on the cooktop


General Maintenance:


Wipe up spills promptly to prevent baked-on residue


Clean control knobs and panels with appropriate non-abrasive cleaners


Check door gaskets for tears or gaps that might affect oven efficiency


Follow manufacturer guidelines for self-cleaning functions to avoid component stress

While some maintenance is DIY-friendly, certain situations require professional range repair expertise:


Gas-Related Issues: Any problem involving gas connections or persistent gas odors

Component Replacement: Many internal parts require technical knowledge for proper installation


Safety Priority: Always disconnect power before attempting electric range inspections. For gas ranges, never attempt to repair gas-specific components unless you have professional training.

Control Board Issues: The electronic "brain" of the oven may be malfunctioning, causing heating inconsistencies

full_content.content: Gas oven problems usually involve these components:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content:
Weak or Failed Igniter: The "glow bar" igniter must get hot enough to open the safety valve; as igniters age, they may glow but not reach sufficient temperature


Gas Safety Valve Problems: The valve controlling gas flow to the oven burner may be stuck or failing


Faulty Temperature Regulation: Issues with the thermostat or temperature sensor can cause inconsistent heating


Control Module Failures: Electronic controls can malfunction, affecting all oven functions

full_content.content: Case Study: Control Board Replacement Saves Expensive Range
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: A family with a Frigidaire Gallery Series electric range experienced frequent shutoffs, error codes, and an unresponsive touchpad. Assuming these symptoms meant the end for their appliance, they were preparing to purchase a replacement. However, professional diagnosis identified a failing electronic control board as the sole issue.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: A certified technician replaced just this component—a repair costing significantly less than a new range. The appliance returned to perfect working condition, saving the family considerable expense and the inconvenience of selecting and installing a new range.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Case Study: The Importance of Proper Diagnosis
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: After replacing the igniter in their gas oven based on internet advice, a homeowner was frustrated when heating problems persisted. Professional diagnosis revealed that while the new igniter was working correctly, the gas safety valve wasn't opening fully due to an electrical issue in the control system.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: This case highlights the value of accurate professional diagnosis—identifying the actual cause rather than just addressing symptoms based on common problems.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Glossary TermsWhat is a Convection Range?A convection range is a kitchen appliance that features a convection oven, which uses a fan and exhaust system to circulate hot air around the food, resulting in faster, more even cooking and baking compared to conventional ovens.What is a Drop-In Range?A drop-in range is a type of kitchen stove that is designed to be fitted into a pre-existing space in kitchen cabinetry, mounted on a platform, flanked by cabinetry, and often featuring a custom panel at the bottom.What is a Dual Fuel Range?A dual fuel range combines the precision of an electric oven with the responsiveness of a gas cooktop, offering the best of both worlds for cooking enthusiasts.What is BTU?BTU, or British Thermal Unit, measures the amount of heat required to raise the temperature of one pound of water by one degree Fahrenheit.

self.__next_f.push([1,"Is your Frigidaire range not heating correctly? Are the burners failing to ignite? Or perhaps the control panel is unresponsive? These common issues can disrupt your cooking routine, but understanding their causes can help you determine whether simple maintenance, DIY repairs, or professional service is your best next step. Our comprehensive guide combines technical expertise with practical solutions to address the most frequent Frigidaire range problems. 

## Understanding Your Frigidaire Range Components 

Every Frigidaire range, whether gas or electric, combines several key systems that work together to deliver reliable cooking performance. Electric models use precision heating elements for both cooktop and oven functions, while gas models employ a network of valves, igniters, and burners to create and control cooking heat. The control system—which may be simple knobs or a sophisticated digital interface—acts as the command center for all functions. 

With regular maintenance and timely repairs when issues arise, your Frigidaire range can provide many years of dependable service for all your cooking needs. 

## Troubleshooting Electric Frigidaire Range Problems 

### Surface Burner Issues 

When electric cooktop elements fail to heat properly, the problem usually stems from one of these common causes: 

- **Damaged Heating Element**: After years of use, elements can develop weak spots, breaks, or visible damage that affects their performance 

- **Faulty Burner Receptacle**: The socket that connects the element to the range's electrical system can deteriorate from heat cycling 

- **Connection Problems**: Loose or corroded connections between components can cause intermittent heating 

- **Control Switch Failure**: The switch that regulates power to the element may be malfunctioning 

**How to Check**: Carefully swap a problematic burner with one you know works well. If the problem moves with the element, you need a replacement element. If the problem stays in the same location, the receptacle or wiring likely needs attention. 

### Oven Not Heating Correctly 

When your Frigidaire electric oven fails to heat properly, check for these common culprits: 

- **Failed Bake Element**: Look for visible damage like blisters, breaks, or discoloration on the element at the oven bottom 

- **Defective Broil Element**: The upper element may have failed, affecting overall heating and broiling function 

- **Temperature Sensor Problems**: A faulty sensor can cause inaccurate temperature regulation 

- **Control Board Issues**: The electronic "brain" of the oven may be malfunctioning, causing heating inconsistencies 

**Visual Inspection Tip**: With the oven cool and power disconnected, examine the bake element for visible breaks or blistering. Damage usually indicates the element needs replacement. 

When you’re unable to find and resolve a range problem on your own, schedule [stove repair](/repair/range-repair-service) and we’ll send a Sears Home Services technician to your home to fix the problem for you. 

## Diagnosing Gas Frigidaire Range Problems 

### Cooktop Burner Difficulties 

Gas burners that won't light or heat inconsistently typically point to these issues: 

- **Igniter Failure**: The spark igniter may be cracked, misaligned, or electrically faulty 

- **Clogged Burner Ports**: Food spillover can block gas flow through the burner openings 

- **Gas Supply Problems**: Verify the gas valve is fully open and supplying all burners 

- **Control Valve Issues**: The valve regulating gas flow to the burner may be malfunctioning 

**Safety First**: If you smell gas, immediately turn off the gas supply valve, avoid creating sparks or flames, ventilate the area, and call for professional service. 

### Oven Heating Failures 

Gas oven problems usually involve these components: 

- **Weak or Failed Igniter**: The "glow bar" igniter must get hot enough to open the safety valve; as igniters age, they may glow but not reach sufficient temperature 

- **Gas Safety Valve Problems**: The valve controlling gas flow to the oven burner may be stuck or failing 

- **Faulty Temperature Regulation**: Issues with the thermostat or temperature sensor can cause inconsistent heating 

- **Control Module Failures**: Electronic controls can malfunction, affecting all oven functions 

**Key Symptom**: If your igniter glows for more than 90 seconds without lighting the burner, it's likely too weak to open the safety valve and needs replacement. 

When you’re unable to resolve an oven heating problem on your own, schedule [Frigidaire range repair](/repair/frigidaire) service and we’ll send a technician to your home to fix the oven. 

## Electronic Control and Display Problems 

Modern Frigidaire ranges often feature sophisticated control systems that can experience unique issues: 

- **Unresponsive Touchpads**: Control panels may stop responding to touch or button presses 

- **Error Code Displays**: Digital screens may show specific error codes indicating particular failures 

- **Erratic Operation**: Ranges may turn on/off unexpectedly or change settings without input 

- **Power Issues**: Control boards can be affected by power surges or internal component failures 

**Quick Fix Attempt**: For many electronic issues, resetting the range can help. Disconnect power for 1-2 minutes by unplugging the range or turning off the circuit breaker, then restore power. 

For smart-enabled Frigidaire ranges, connectivity problems may involve: 

- WiFi module malfunction 

- Home network configuration issues 

- Software or firmware that needs updating 

- Account or app synchronization problems 

## Real-World Repair Success Stories 

### Case Study: Control Board Replacement Saves Expensive Range 

A family with a Frigidaire Gallery Series electric range experienced frequent shutoffs, error codes, and an unresponsive touchpad. Assuming these symptoms meant the end for their appliance, they were preparing to purchase a replacement. However, professional diagnosis identified a failing electronic control board as the sole issue. 

A certified technician replaced just this component—a repair costing significantly less than a new range. The appliance returned to perfect working condition, saving the family considerable expense and the inconvenience of selecting and installing a new range. 

### Case Study: The Importance of Proper Diagnosis 

After replacing the igniter in their gas oven based on internet advice, a homeowner was frustrated when heating problems persisted. Professional diagnosis revealed that while the new igniter was working correctly, the gas safety valve wasn't opening fully due to an electrical issue in the control system. 

This case highlights the value of accurate professional diagnosis—identifying the actual cause rather than just addressing symptoms based on common problems. 

### Preventative Maintenance for Your Frigidaire Range 

Regular [appliance maintenance](/maintain/appliance-maintenance) significantly extends your range's lifespan and prevents many common issues. 

### For Electric Ranges: 

- Keep surface elements clean from food buildup 

- Check for loose connections at element receptacles 

- Clean the oven interior regularly to prevent residue from burning onto elements 

- Verify that drip pans are clean and properly positioned 

### For Gas Ranges: 

- Clean burner caps and ports regularly to ensure proper gas flow 

- Inspect igniter electrodes for food debris or misalignment 

- Check for loose gas connections (if you smell gas, call for service immediately) 

- Ensure burner grates sit properly on the cooktop 

### General Maintenance: 

- Wipe up spills promptly to prevent baked-on residue 

- Clean control knobs and panels with appropriate non-abrasive cleaners 

- Check door gaskets for tears or gaps that might affect oven efficiency 

- Follow manufacturer guidelines for self-cleaning functions to avoid component stress 

## When Professional Frigidaire Range Repair Is Necessary 

While some maintenance is DIY-friendly, certain situations require professional range repair expertise: 

- **Gas-Related Issues**: Any problem involving gas connections or persistent gas odors 

- **Electrical Repairs**: Internal wiring problems or electronic control failures 

- **Calibration Needs**: Precise temperature adjustment requires specialized tools 

- **Persistent Problems**: Issues that continue after basic troubleshooting 

- **Component Replacement**: Many internal parts require technical knowledge for proper installation 

**Safety Priority**: Always disconnect power before attempting electric range inspections. For gas ranges, never attempt to repair gas-specific components unless you have professional training. 

### Why Choose Sears Home Services for Your Frigidaire Range Repair 

When your Frigidaire range needs professional attention, Sears Home Services offers significant advantages: 

- **Manufacturer-Specific Training**: Our technicians receive specialized training on Frigidaire appliances 

- **Genuine Replacement Parts**: We use only authentic Frigidaire components designed for your specific model 

- **Diagnostic Expertise**: Our systematic troubleshooting identifies root causes, not just symptoms 

- **Nationwide Service Network**: Consistent quality standards wherever you're located 

- **Service Guarantee**: We stand behind our repairs with solid warranty coverage 

Our technicians have successfully completed over 100,000 Frigidaire range repairs, building unmatched expertise with these appliances. 

## Schedule Your Frigidaire Range Repair Today 

Don't let cooking problems persist. Our experienced technicians can quickly diagnose and repair your Frigidaire range, restoring perfect functionality. 

Schedule range repair service online now or call 1-800-374-4432 to speak with our customer service team. 

*Sears Home Services – Your trusted partner for Frigidaire range repair and maintenance.* 
"])

self.__next_f.push([1,"First of all, if you’re nervous about working on your gas oven (or not completely confident in your DIY appliance repair abilities) then you’ll need to [oven repair service](/repair/oven-repair-service) to have a Sears Home Services technician diagnose and repair your oven when it won’t heat. Safety should always be your highest priority when fixing appliances—even if you need to have someone repair your oven for you.

Even if you're sure that you'll have an appliance technician complete the oven repair, it doesn’t hurt to understand the troubleshooting and repair process involved in fixing a gas oven that won’t heat. There's a chance that you can follow some of the troubleshooting steps described below and safely fix the oven yourself.

If you want some practical troubleshooting advice to see if you can fix a non-heating gas oven yourself, you're in the right place. Carefully follow the troubleshooting and diagnostic advice described below to repair a gas oven that isn't heating.

## Basic Troubleshooting Steps To Fix a Gas Oven That Won’t Heat

When troubleshooting any appliance failure, start with the basics. Sometimes a simple fix does the trick.

### Check the Gas Supply

Just about anyone can follow these basic tips to check the gas supply going to the range or wall oven:

* If you’re troubleshooting the oven on a gas range, turn on a surface burner to see if it’s getting gas. If a surface burner works, then you know that your oven should be getting gas as well.
* If the surface burner doesn’t work, check the gas supply cut-off valve for your stove to make sure that it's open. 
* If you’re troubleshooting a wall oven, check to see if the broil burner gets gas and heats up (if your wall oven has a separate broil burner). If you have a double oven, you can check to see if the 2nd oven is heating. If other burners in a wall oven are heating, then you know that the inoperative oven burner should be getting gas as well.
* If no burners in your wall oven are heating, check the gas supply cut-off valve for the oven to make sure that it’s open.
* If gas supply valve for your stove or wall oven is open and you’re not getting gas to the appliance, check other gas appliances in your home such as the gas dryer. If your entire home is without gas, check the main gas cut-off valve for your house. Open the main cut-off valve if it’s shut. This may restore gas to your oven and other appliances so they work properly.

If the main gas cut-off valve for your home is open and no appliances are getting gas, then you need to contact your gas supplier to figure out what’s wrong.

If other appliances are getting gas but you suspect that your wall oven or stove isn’t getting gas, then you’ll likely need to have a plumber or gas technician from your gas supplier fix the gas supply going to your stove or wall oven.

### Check the Service Cut-Off Valve

Many gas ranges have a service cut-off valve on their pressure regulator at the back of the stove. It shuts off the gas supply to the oven but not the surface burners. 

If the surface burners on your gas stove work but the oven burners aren’t getting gas, make sure that the lever on the service cut-off valve is in the open position.

![Checking the service cut-off valve](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/3sUOqIPGTYVRNvsIYQHlov/4b8cffc6edcafbfed88dfb940a91afd0/Check_the_service_cut-off_valve.png)

## Advanced Troubleshooting For a Gas Oven That Won’t Heat

When the basic troubleshooting steps don’t do the trick, you’ll need to conduct some advanced troubleshooting to fix a gas oven that isn’t heating. Nothing’s better than a YouTube video to describe advanced troubleshooting for a non-heating gas oven. Follow the steps in this Sears PartsDirect YouTube video to fix your gas oven:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iuRrcw6y7Dc" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

After the video goes through some of the basic troubleshooting steps described above, the following diagnostic techniques are used to figure out what’s wrong with a gas oven that won’t heat.

### Test the Oven Igniter

Most gas ovens use a glow bar ignition system that uses this ignition process:

1. The control sends electrical current through the igniter and safety gas valve to light the oven burner and heat the oven.
2. The igniter heats up but the safety gas valve won't open to ignite the burner until the igniter reaches a safe ignition temperature.
3. As the igniter heats up, the resistance of the igniter element decreases and more current flows through the circuit to the safety gas valve.
4. When the igniter reaches ignition temperature, its resistance is low enough to allow enough current to flow through the circuit and open the safety gas valve.
5. Gas flows through the open valve and to the burner and ignites.

The number 1 failure preventing a gas oven from heating is a weak igniter. The igniter won’t get hot enough to allow adequate current to flow to the safety valve so the valve won’t open to let gas flow to the burner for ignition.

That’s why we recommend testing the oven igniter first.

Pull the bottom panel out of your cold oven. Start the oven and see if the igniter glows.

If the igniter glows but the burner doesn’t ignite because the gas valve doesn’t open, then you’ll likely need to replace the igniter. As noted in the video, if you're uncertain whether your glowing igniter has failed, you can [schedule service for your oven](/repair/oven-repair-service) and have a Sears service technician check the amp draw through the igniter circuit.

If you’re convinced that the oven igniter is bad, then you can [order a new igniter](https://www.searspartsdirect.com/category/1234574/range-parts) and replace the igniter. Replacing a gas oven igniter is a relatively safe repair that most DIY’ers can accomplish on their own because it doesn’t involve disconnecting any gas lines in the oven. Follow the steps in this YouTube video to replace the oven igniter:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/DTXwfTiFZfE" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Now, if the igniter __doesn’t__ glow, then the igniter element may be broken. You’ll need a [multimeter](https://www.sears.com/craftsman-multimeter-digital-with-8-functions-and-20/p-03482141000P) to check resistance through the igniter so see if the element is bad.

Unplug the range. For safety, always disconnect power before checking resistance. To check the resistance of the igniter, put the meter leads on the igniter terminals. If you measure between 10 and 2,500 ohms, then you know your igniter is okay.

If the igniter measures no continuity, then you need to replace the igniter.

## Test the Safety Gas Valve

Next, check resistance through the safety gas valve. The meter should measure less than 5 ohms of resistance through the terminals on the safety gas valve. 

If the safety gas valve measures no continuity, you can [have a Sears technician replace that part](/repair/range-repair-service). Replacing the safety gas valve involve disconnection of gas lines inside the oven.

## Check the Wiring and Control Board

When you find that the igniter and safety gas valve appear to be okay, you’ll need to check wiring in the ignition circuit and the electronic oven control board. 

With electrical power still disconnected from the oven, access the back of the electronic oven control board and check resistance through the ignition circuit wires connected to the electronic control board. 

If you measure the same resistance through the ignition circuit as you measured through the igniter (between 10 and 2,500 ohms), then replace the electronic control board because you know that the wiring through the ignition circuit is okay.

If you measure infinite resistance (also called an open load) through the ignition circuit wiring, then you'll need to trace the wires through the ignition circuit and repair the broken wire (with the oven still disconnected from electrical power).

These DIY troubleshooting steps should help you fix a gas oven that isn’t heating in most situations. If you can’t figure out what’s wrong and fix the oven on your own, don’t hesitate to [schedule oven repair service](/repair/oven-repair-service) and we’ll send a Sears Tech right out to your home to fix the oven."])

self.__next_f.push([1,"## What Is an Electric Range?

An electric range is a type of kitchen appliance that combines both an electric stove and oven, allowing you to cook on the stovetop and bake or roast within the oven compartment. These ranges are popular for their ease of use, steady heat control, and fewer safety risks compared to gas appliances.

---

![electric-range-components](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/4I5uGYoLWhlJ9z8UbAhgn7/2c98d4e9ce3b25988c717f4f74f2b30c/electric-range-components.png)

## Core Components of an Electric Range

To understand how an electric range works, let’s first look at its key components:

* __Heating Elements:__ Electric ranges have two types of heating elements—one for the stovetop and one for the oven. Heating elements work by sending a stream of electrical current through a high-resistance wire that heats up as electrons collide with current-resistant metal.
* __Stovetop Burners:__ Coils elements or radiant surface elements for a ceramic glass top ranges heat up to provide direct heat for pots and pans.
* __Oven Heating Elements:__ Usually located at the top and bottom of the oven, these elements create the temperature needed for baking and roasting.
* __Surface Burner Control Switches:__ Also known as burner infinite switches, these components control the heat level of stovetop burners.
* __Electronic Oven Control Board:__ This circuit board governs oven operations including the bake mode, broil mode and self-cleaning mode.
* __Oven Temperature Sensor:__ This device senses oven temperature and sends that signal to the electronic oven control board to accurately control oven temperature.
* __Control Panel:__ Houses oven and stovetop controls that allow you to adjust the oven temperature, timer, and control surface elements.
* __Electrical Wiring:__ Powers the heating elements and controls, allowing electricity to flow through the appliance safely.

---

## How Electric Stovetop Burners Work

When you turn on an electric stovetop burner, a few steps occur to generate heat:

__Step 1:__ Turning burner control knob on the control panel allows electricity to flow to the coil or ceramic element.
__Step 2:__ The heating element’s resistance to the electricity causes it to heat up. This principle, known as Joule heating, is the same process that warms up an electric space heater.
__Step 3:__ The stovetop burner will continue to heat up until it reaches the desired temperature, and then the control switch maintains that temperature by cycling the element on and off.

---

## How the Electric Oven Works

The electric oven functions in much the same way as the stovetop but involves more complex temperature control to ensure consistent cooking.

__Step 1:__ When you set the oven to a specific temperature, electricity flows to the oven’s heating elements (usually at the top and bottom).
__Step 2:__ These elements warm up and distribute heat evenly across the oven interior.
__Step 3:__ The oven’s temperature constantly monitors the oven cavity temperature, cycling the heating elements on and off to keep it consistent.

---

![setting-electric-oven-controls](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/2dy1dPivjv8LU5mYZhiJS7/98633129d34e020c49106923e6c1b8ab/setting-electric-oven-controls.png)

## Oven Heating Options:

* __Bake Setting:__ Activates the bottom heating element, making it ideal for baking.
* __Broil Setting:__ Activates the top heating element, providing direct heat from above for browning and finishing dishes.
* __Convection Option (if available):__ A fan circulates hot air, offering more uniform cooking and quicker results.

---

## Advantages of Electric Ranges

Electric ranges have several benefits:

* __Steady, Even Heat:__ Electric burners heat consistently, allowing for precise cooking.
* __Ease of Installation:__ Most homes are equipped with electrical outlets, while gas lines are less common.
* __Low Maintenance:__ Electric ranges have fewer parts and are easier to clean, especially with smooth-top surfaces.
* __Safety:__ No open flame reduces fire risks and eliminates the need for ventilation.
* __Rebates:__ Using an electric range helps the environment when compared to a gas range, so you can soon get up to an $840 rebate for switching from a gas to electric range under the [HEEHRA](/blog/what-is-heehra) electrification provisions of the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act passed by the U.S. Congress.

---

![cleaning-a-glass-electric-stovetop](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/5USJvVWBolEh0zTuLPhsUi/f7fc2a4747eba616db27c28c07e9ae9c/cleaning-a-glass-electric-stovetop.png)

## Maintenance Tips for Electric Ranges

To keep your electric range working efficiently and safely, consider these maintenance tips:

* __Clean Regularly:__ Wipe down the stovetop after each use, and regularly clean oven spills to prevent buildup.
* __Inspect Heating Elements:__ Check for visible damage, like cracks or worn-out coils, and replace if necessary.
* __Use Correct Cookware:__ Ensure the cookware is flat-bottomed and appropriate for electric burners.
* __Professional Maintenance:__ Schedule annual [range maintenance](/maintain) to have a professional inspect the wiring, controls and components to ensure the stove stays in good condition. Immediately schedule [range repair](/repair/range-repair-service) if you notice any issues or failures.

---

## Troubleshooting Common Electric Range Issues

If your electric range isn’t functioning correctly, these DIY troubleshooting tips might help.

### Oven Won’t Heat

An inadequate power supply, wiring failure, bad bake element, defective temperature sensor or failed electronic control board all could all prevent an electric oven from heating. Watch this video from Sears PartsDirect to see how to troubleshoot the problem.

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vew8pn1t6oM" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

If you’re unable to find and fix the oven heating problem yourself, schedule [range repair](/repair) service to have a Sears Home Services technician resolve the issue.

### Surface Element Won’t Heat

A failed element, wiring failure or a broken surface element control switch could be the reason that a stovetop element is not working. Follow the DIY troubleshooting steps in this video to resolve the problem on your own.

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ILco1ob6Vps" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

If you’re unable to fix the surface element heating problem on your own, schedule repair service and we’ll send a technician to your home to fix the issue for you.

### Range Won’t Power Up

When your range doesn't work at all, it's likely that the range has no electrical power for the display or controls. Possible causes are a tripped house circuit breaker for the range, a problem with the outlet cord (not plugged in or broken) or an internal wiring failure. 

Check the house circuit breaker for your range and reset the breaker if you find it tripped.

Unplug the range and check the terminal block on the back of the range for loose wires or broken terminals. Replace the terminal block if damaged.

A blown thermal fuse can prevent the control from powering up on some ranges. Some ranges have a relay control board that supplies power to the display and controls so a failed relay control board could prevent the range from working.

If you’re unable to find the cause of the power problem, schedule [range repair](/repair) service and we’ll send a tech to your home to fix the range for you.

---

Understanding the workings of an electric range can help you make the most of this appliance and ensure it operates safely and efficiently for years to come. By knowing how each part functions—from the stovetop burners to the oven’s heating elements—you’re better equipped to troubleshoot issues, maintain the appliance, and make delicious meals with confidence.

---
"])

self.__next_f.push([1,"Follow these steps to replace a burnt out coil surface element.

![Image of the model number location on a typical stove](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/3MB1EclZJQr6UBvzAAW7RA/d50c4eac7ef3b13bba7e2eb2bbbe76a2/Image_of_the_model_number_location_on_a_typical_stove.jpg)

## 1. Order the Replacement Part

Find and use the model number of your stove to order the correct replacement element. You’ll typically find the model number on the frame of the stove just above the right front leveling leg. Open the bottom storage or broiler drawer to see the model number sticker. On some ranges, the model number is on the side of the oven door.

Once you find the model number of your stove, look up the replacement part for the burnt out element on the [Sears PartsDirect website](https://www.searspartsdirect.com/) and order the new element.

---

![Image of homeowner shutting off the circuit breaker for the stove](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/7eU4FKPefemTgd17frLsZR/c7586d82baebdfd63ea434b99c119b16/Image_of_homeowner_shutting_off_the_circuit_breaker_for_the_stove.jpg)

## 2. Disconnect Electrical Power

Once you receive the replacement part, disconnect power from the stove by unplugging the power cord or shutting off the house circuit breakers for the stove. The 2 circuit breakers for the stove are typically connected together to you just need to shut off a double switch. If you live in a older home with fuses instead of breakers, you need to remove the fuses for the stove to disconnect electrical power.

Make sure the surface burner elements are cool before starting the repair.

---

![Image of homeowner removing the coil stove element image](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/3vK85ONr8VsHV83iHMOUv4/4bd6f05b0190335b321384d9b1fc1675/Image_of_homeowner_removing_the_coil_stove_element_image.jpg)

## 3. Remove the Element

Carefully pull the element out of its connection terminal, lifting it slightly as you slide it out.

---

![Image of homeowner installing a new surface coil element in a range](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/6wR9VtK6ormp2Pamw05sYY/a542ee268e00fb1b8b7e2330ab1fc096/Image_of_homeowner_installing_a_new_surface_coil_element_in_a_range.jpg)

## 4. Install the New Element

Push the new coil element into the connection terminal and push it down onto the edge of the drip bowl.

---

## 5. Restore Electrical Power to the Stove

Plug the stove back in or reset the house circuit breakers for the stove to restore electrical power. If your home uses house fuses, reinstall the house fuses for the stove to restore power.

---

## What To Do When the Coil Element Doesn’t Heat

When a coil surface element doesn’t heat, the failure causing the problem isn’t always a bad element. Here’s a DIY repair video that shows how to diagnose and fix a problem with a coil surface element not heating.

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/eLZcldj0J3k" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

---

## Sears Home Services Can Replace a Burnt Out Stove Element When You Have a Glass Top Range

When your stove has a ceramic glass top, schedule [range repair near you](/repair/range-repair-service) with a Sears Home Services Technician to replace the burnt out stove element. Our technicians are factory trained on most major brands and are qualified for [LG stove repair](/repair/lg/range), [Maytag stove repair](/repair/maytag/range), [Whirlpool range repair](/repair/whirlpool/range), and more. Safely lifting the glass top and replacing a radiant surface element is a challenge for most appliance repair DIY’ers. 

---

## Keep Your Stove in Top Shape With Annual Professional Maintenance by Sears Home Services

Depend on Sears Home Services to help you keep your stove in top shape with by [scheduling annual stove maintenance checks](/maintain). Our technician will perform the following services during the visit:

* __Check control operation.__  Range controls are checked for accurate temperature control of the oven and stovetop burners. Faulty controls can cause the range to waste energy when overheating occurs.
* __Examine oven door alignment and clean the oven door gasket.__ A loose door gasket or bent door hinges can prevent the oven door from sealing, allowing heat to escape during baking. You’ll wind up paying higher energy bills because the burner ignites more often and stays burning longer to heat the oven. The technician adjusts and cleans the oven door gasket to make sure it seals the oven door properly.
* __Test oven self-cleaning operation.__ On ranges that have self-cleaning ovens, the service technician checks the control and oven door lock to make sure it stays closed during the self-cleaning cycle. During the self-cleaning operation, oven heats to extremely high temperatures to burn spills and residue inside the oven to ash. To prevent fires, the oven door must remain closed and locked during self-cleaning. If you were to open the door during self-cleaning, a sudden rush of air into the extremely hot oven can cause a serious fire. 
* __Check and clean the stovetop burners.__ The technician cleans and checks electric elements to make sure they’re operating properly and safely. A short circuit in an electric stovetop burner can cause a serious electrocution risk. An element on a glass-top range that overheats can damage the glass top. On a gas range, the technician cleans checks and adjusts the surface burners. A dirty surface burner can fail to ignite – posing a serious safety risk. 
* __Check oven burners or elements.__ The technician examines and adjusts oven burners in a gas range or electric elements in an electric range. Gas oven burners that aren’t adjusted correctly can fail to heat the oven properly and may emit excessive carbon monoxide. Electric elements that aren’t heating correctly will fail to heat the oven properly. A shorted electric element also can pose a serious electrocution risk.
* __Inspect readily accessible electrical wiring.__ The technician will check the wiring on gas and electric ranges, for insulation damage, proper grounding and secure connections. Damaged wiring or wiring that’s not secure can cause an electrocution risk. The ground connection dissipates an electrical short to prevent you from getting an electric shock if a loose wire touches metal in the range. 
* __Level the range and check the anti-tip device.__ The technician levels the range to reduce the risk that a pot or pan will accidentally slide off a gas surface burner. Leveling also helps items bake properly in the oven. The anti-tip device is an essential bracket that prevents the range from tipping forward when you open the oven door and extend an oven rack out of the range with a dish on the rack.

Having your stove professionally cleaned and maintained every year will help keep it operating efficiently and lasting longer.

We can keep all of your home appliances in top shape when you [schedule our Kitchen & Laundry Appliance Check-Up](/maintain/kitchen-laundry-appliance-check-up). Our technician will clean and maintain all of your appliances in one convenient visit to keep your home operating smoothly all year long. Additionally, all of your appliances will last longer when you keep them well maintained.

Trust Sears Home Services to help you manage your entire home so you can sit back, relax and enjoy your life with ease.

---"])

self.__next_f.push([1,"## The Basics: What Is a Gas Stove?

A gas stove is a cooking appliance that uses natural gas or propane as its fuel source. When ignited, the gas produces a flame that heats cookware directly. This direct heat offers unmatched control, allowing you to make quick adjustments to temperature, which is why gas stoves are often preferred in many kitchens.

---

## How Does a Gas Stove Work?

A gas stove connects to your home’s gas supply through a gas line with a shut-off valve. The incoming gas supply then connects to a pressure regulator that limits gas pressure and flow to design specifications for your stove.

From the pressure regulator, the gas supply branches out to the cooktop burners and the oven burners. Here are descriptions of those stove systems.

### Cooktop Burner System

Here’s how the cooktop burner system works in a gas stove:

* Gas from the pressure regulator first goes to the cooktop burner control valves. 
* When you turn on a cooktop burner, gas travels from the control valve to the burner head. 
* The control valve has an igniter switch that sends current to the spark igniter electrode next to the burner head to ignite the gas when you turn on a cooktop burner. The burner ignites and begins heating.
* You can adjust the cooktop burner flame by rotating the burner control valve.
* When you’ve finished cooking on the burner, you can shut off the control valve and the burner flame will go out.

### How a Gas Oven Works

* When you set your desired temperature and turn the control knob on, the thermostat sends electric current to the glow bar igniter to start the oven. If you have an oven with an electronic control panel, the electronic control board will activate a relay and send current to the glow bar ignition system to light the burner.
* The igniter heats up and glows to ignite the burner when the safety gas valve opens. For safety, the gas valve in the ignition system won’t open until the glow bar gets hot enough to ignite the gas and allows enough electrical current to flow downstream to the current-activated switch on that device.
* As the glow bar igniter heats up, its electrical resistance decreases to allow more current to flow to the safety gas valve. Once the igniter glow bar is so hot that it allows more than 3 amps of current to the safety gas valve switch, the bi-metal switch on the safety gas valve trips. This opens the gas valve and gas flows to the burner tube and ignites.
* The glow bar igniter continues to glow as the burner flames heat the oven. When the oven reaches the set temperature, the control shuts off current to the igniter and safety gas valve. The burner shuts off and stays off until oven temperature decreases about 10 degrees below the oven temperature set point. Then the ignition process repeats to light the burner and maintain the set temperature.

---

## Benefits of Cooking with a Gas Stove

The oven and cooktop of a gas stove offer significant advantages over electric ranges.

### Benefits of a Gas Stovetop

* __Instant Heat:__ Flames appear immediately upon ignition. Fast heating burners save you time when cooking.
* __Precise Temperature Control:__ You can quickly increase or decrease surface burner heat by adjusting the knob. A gas burner provides consistent heating because it doesn’t cycle on and off like an electric surface element does when heating.
* __Even Heat Distribution:__ Flames wrap around cookware for uniform cooking.
* __Cost Efficiency:__ Natural gas and propane is often cheaper than electricity for powering stoves.

### Advantages of a Gas Oven

* __Quick Preheating:__ Gas ovens heat up faster than electric ovens because they generate heat directly from the flame.
* __Moist Baking Environment:__ The combustion process releases moisture, which can help prevent foods from drying out—ideal for baking and roasting.
* __Precise Temperature Control:__ Adjusting the oven temperature will result in quicker response in a gas oven. Also, the gas flame provides more immediate and precise heat level adjustments to consistently maintain baking temperature at the chosen setting.
* __Cost Efficiency:__ Natural gas and propane is often cheaper than electricity for heating the oven.

---

## Tips for Safe and Efficient Gas Stove Use

Follow these expert tips to use your gas stove safely.

### Ensure Proper Ventilation

Gas stoves release combustion byproducts, so make sure your kitchen is well-ventilated. Run the range hood when using the gas stove.

Keep the range hood running for a few minutes after you finish cooking or baking to exhaust all combustion fumes out of your kitchen.

### Keep Burners Clean Regularly

Clogged burner nozzles can cause combustion problems and affect flame performance. Follow the procedure shown in this popular YouTube video to thoroughly clean stove top burners:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/9m5nF-uvwkI" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

### Turn Off Burners Properly

Always double-check that burners are completely off after cooking.

### Check for Leaks

Periodically inspect your gas supply line and connections. 

Use soapy water to detect leaks—bubbles will form where gas escapes from leaks or loose gas line connections.

If you ever smell gas, turn off the stove immediately, ventilate the area, and contact your local gas company.

### Avoid Overcrowding the Oven

Overcrowding the oven can block heat circulation, leading to air circulation problems in the oven cavity and uneven cooking.

Follow the tips in this helpful YouTube video to position and use oven racks properly:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/r_tcl5NCDjo" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

### Professional Maintenance

Schedule professional [oven maintenance](/maintain) every year. A qualified service technician will visit your home and perform these essential oven maintenance, inspection and cleaning tasks:

* Inspect gas supply connections.
* Check the ignition systems.
* Inspect surface and oven burners and clean them if needed.
* Examine cooktop and oven flames and adjust the flame settings if necessary.
* Check the overall cooktop and oven performance.
* Inspect readily accessible electrical wiring.
* Level the stove if necessary.

Annual professional maintenance won’t just ensure that the stove works safely and efficiently, it will also help your appliance last longer.

---

## Common Gas Stove Problems and Solutions

### Cooktop Issues

* __Uneven Flame or Yellow Flame:__ Indicates improper gas-to-air ratio. Clean the burner and check for obstructions.
* __Burner Not Igniting:__ Check the ignition system and ensure the burner is clean and dry. A surface burner igniter switch and a spark module control the sparking for burners. A power supply problem, failed igniter switch, bad spark module or wiring failure in the spark ignition circuit can prevent the electrodes from sparking.

### Gas Oven Problems

Follow these expert troubleshooting tips when you encounter problems with your gas stove’s oven.

#### Gas Oven Won’t Heat

Several different problems can prevent the oven in your gas stove from heating. Follow the tips in this popular YouTube DIY video to fix an oven heating problem in your gas stove:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iuRrcw6y7Dc" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

If you’re unable to find and fix the oven heating problem yourself, schedule [range repair](/repair/range-repair-service) service and we’ll send a Sears Home Services technician to your home to resolve the issue.

#### Oven Temperature is Wrong

If the oven isn't heating to the baking temperature you set — it's too hot or not hot enough — the oven temperature sensor could be malfunctioning. Or the problem could be with the electronic oven control board, which controls oven functions.

You can test the oven temperature sensor probe by unplugging the range and measuring sensor probe resistance using a multimeter. It should measure about 1,080 ohms of resistance through most probes at room temperature.

Refer to the tech sheet for the probe's resistance specification for your range. You can likely find the tech sheet in the control console or taped to the back of the range. Replace the oven temperature sensor probe if the multimeter doesn't measure the correct resistance through the probe. If the probe is okay, you might need to replace the electronic oven control board.

If you’re unable to find and fix the cause of this problem on your own, schedule [stove repair](/repair/range-repair-service) service and we’ll fix the issue for you.

---

Gas stoves continue to be a favorite among home cooks. Their straightforward yet effective design combines practicality with precise performance, making them indispensable in kitchens across the country.

Whether you’re simmering a delicate sauce or searing a steak, understanding how your gas stove works empowers you to make the most of this versatile appliance. Plus, with proper care and maintenance, your gas stove will serve you reliably for years to come.

Sears Home Services is standing by to help you with gas stove maintenance and repairs any time you need them. Trust us to handle all of your home appliance needs.

---
